646491857.name: Gezi/Travel
646491857.author: a TripAdvisor user
646491857.reviewBody: Very nice place. If you want to travel by boat and take very special photos, Las Barillas is a perfect place.

638996707.name: Me encanto el recorrido
638996707.author: a TripAdvisor user
638996707.reviewBody: ME llene de energ\u00eda y paz, al caminar por la selva, conocer m\u00e1s sobre las especies locales, ver al jaguarundi, vivir esa experiencia fue muy bella.

address.streetAddress: Camino al Ejido Cangrejera Uno S/N

659682774.name: Excelente lugar
659682774.author: a TripAdvisor user
659682774.reviewBody: Es un buen lugar para realizar sus eventos sociales como bodas, xv a\u00f1os o cualquier otra celebracion, ademas la arquitectura del lugar es muy modernista, los espacios son muy acojedores, y el teatro es espectacular sin lugar a dudas.

address.streetAddress: Av. Abraham Zabludowsky No. 201 El Encanto

638433320.name: Excelente Sitio para descubrir cosas nuevas
638433320.author: a TripAdvisor user
638433320.reviewBody: Excelente Lugar con fant\u00e1stica distribuci\u00f3n de espacios y nuevos eventos  regularmente por lo que siempre encontramos algo nuevo

address.streetAddress: Av. Abraham Zabludowsky No. 201 El Encanto

625021818.name: agradable
625021818.author: a TripAdvisor user
625021818.reviewBody: un lugar agradable para ir con la familia cuando hay evento, una excelente ubicacion del lugar y muy buena seguridad

address.streetAddress: Av. Abraham Zabludowsky No. 201 El Encanto

594609632.name: Lugar amplio y bien presentado para eventos
594609632.author: a TripAdvisor user
594609632.reviewBody: Tiene buena ubicaci\u00f3n, accesos y estacionamiento, con salones que pueden ampliarse o reducirse para eventos sociales, p\u00fablicos y privados, incluyendo una  \u00e1rea para exposiciones

address.streetAddress: Av. Abraham Zabludowsky No. 201 El Encanto

642291281.name: A historic beach
642291281.author: a TripAdvisor user
642291281.reviewBody: The Coatza malecon has been famous as a place to enjoy the beach, but recent security issues kind of take the fun out of a place you used to be able to hang out, party, or just sit on the beach until sunrise.  It\'s still beautiful and worth going during the day or early evening.  Try a sunrise.  There are no palapas or other facilities, so go prepared for that.  The statuary along the malecon is also wonderful; at least DRIVE the malecon and check out all the statues and the rows of artfully-painted houses along the street.  Other people are mentioning bad smells but I was there for four days and never smelled anything offensive.

522402632.name: Nice sea views but very smelly.
522402632.author: a TripAdvisor user
522402632.reviewBody: The Malecon is like a long promenade on the Gulf of Mexico beach in Coatzacoalcos. My hotel, Fairfield Inn & suites by Marriot is on the Malecon. The view form the room is excellent, but the smell outside coming form the beach is terrible. I did see some of the locals swimming in the sea. But I chose not to join them.

483672899.name: Don\'t get too close.
483672899.author: a TripAdvisor user
483672899.reviewBody: Nice view of the ocean. Many of the locals enjoy the malecon and beach. Most locals avoid. Can be dangerous to the unwary because of criminal element. Especially at night. Best not to go alone. The reason for the bad smell is because Coatzacoalcos lacks sewage treatment plants. The beach/ocean is their sewer. Hard to believe , but true. In some places the sewer water flows above ground across the malecon to the beach. How do I know ? I have lived here for 6 years. Save your time and money for the cleaner more tourist oriented destinations of Mexico. Better to throw up from cheap tequila from Senor Froggys than from typhoid in Coatzacoalcos.

456075795.name: Through the trash, the beauty of the sea comes through
456075795.author: a TripAdvisor user
456075795.reviewBody: This is a long walkway next to the sea with regular access points to the beach along the way. Coatzacoalcos is not among the grand colonial cities of Mexico, so with the exception of a few unique modern structures, there isn\'t much in the way of architectural significance to be found on this walk. I don\'t think locals are less responsible about policing up after their own trash here than elsewhere, and it appears regular efforts are made to keep the beach clear, but there is no keeping up with the offal of ships and other craft of all sizes that ply waters as heavily as they do here. The beach, in other words and to put it kindly, is not pristine. The city has the look generally of a place where there is more to be done than time and resources allow. There is deep poverty here and it shows in the quality of buildings and the lack of upkeep. \n\nStill, unlike other places I\'ve been that are caught in the clutches of poverty, I have not felt threatened or unsafe. People are happy and friendly here, generally courteous to fellow motorists, and aware of bicyclists and pedestrians. Neither are beggars or merchants aggressive. And food...especially seafood...is savory, fresh, and inexpensive. Travel to places like this is not for everyone, but if you can be adaptable and have a sense of adventure I\'d say give it a go!

444127369.name: Could be better
444127369.author: a TripAdvisor user
444127369.reviewBody: Long beach, but realy dirty and sometimes quite smelly. Not fot sunbathing, not for swimming, not for joggers. Dangerous after dark. If someone will take care could be much better.

418057587.name: Nice view and ride
418057587.author: a TripAdvisor user
418057587.reviewBody:
Nice view and ride. I always like ocean view.
Hotels and places to eat along the avenue.
At night you should be careful if you want to walk along.

376888391.name: It is not clean and I do not fell safe
376888391.author: a TripAdvisor user
376888391.reviewBody: Dirty beach at most of the parts, except from close to the piramid.\nI also did not feel really safe running there at night.

331500876.name: Malecon
331500876.author: a TripAdvisor user
331500876.reviewBody: If you get here at 8am you will be just in time to watch the bulldozers cut channels in the Sand from the sewers to the ocean.Need I say more.

529571881.name: First class shppoing mall
529571881.author: a TripAdvisor user
529571881.reviewBody: I visited this place during my business trips to Coatzacoalcos. The shops are good, it includes a Sears and a Liverpool as well as many other top-level shops. There is a food court, with many Mexican cuisine fast food restaurants. If you like a quieter meal, there is a good restaurant in a shop called Sanborns. The meal was very good, well served and the staff are very polite. It is not expensive, but delightfully quiet and clean. Well worth a good recommendation.

464908595.name: Shopping shopping
464908595.author: a TripAdvisor user
464908595.reviewBody:
İdeal place to spend time in a climated atmosphere. You can see the tle locals shoping ,eating..
I m not sure about the prices but you can find all grand brands together.
Food court not so rich..Mixed together international fast food chains and local restaurants.
Good place to waste time..

444127595.name: Shopping mall like all
444127595.author: a TripAdvisor user
444127595.reviewBody: Same shopping mall like in any other place at the world. Nothing more nothing less. Enjoy your shopping and leave.

397055983.name: Nice shopping center and good restaurant and nice movie theaters
397055983.author: a TripAdvisor user
397055983.reviewBody: If you want to have a good breakfast, lunch or dinner you can have it in the Forum Plaza, where there are restaurants like Applebee, Sanborns, Comix and Italianis there is also an area where you can have a hamburguer, sandwiches or Mexican food in the Food Court.\n\nThe movie theater is very nice it has 8 different cinemas

273200488.name: GREAT SHOPPING  AND ENTERTAINING  IN COATZACOALCOS
273200488.author: a TripAdvisor user
273200488.reviewBody: Plaza Forum shopping  mall  offers  great shopping venues in a comfortable and  moder n  atmosphere  , this  nice shopping mall  include  several   movie theaters , restaurants,  even  a Casino  .\nThera are  several  deparment stores and some hundred  boutiques all indoors .

646567016.name: Gezi/Travel
646567016.author: a TripAdvisor user
646567016.reviewBody: You can see ancient stones and status. Museum employees are very friendly and helpful people. You need 30 minutes to visit museum.

481105040.name: Very Interesting little museum
481105040.author: a TripAdvisor user
481105040.reviewBody: This is a fascinating little museum in the pyramid at the end of the Malecon.  Although the sea, salt and sand have taken it\'s toll, there is a lot of renovation work currently going on.  It is worth the visit and the entrance fee is just a gesture at only 10 pesos per person.\n

456071235.name: Closed!
456071235.author: a TripAdvisor user
456071235.reviewBody: Cool structure reminiscent of Olmec pyramids, but being right on the beach and constantly battered by salt spray the metal parts have rusted away and there doesn\'t appear to be any effort underway to fix it.

444124864.name: Not much, but....
444124864.author: a TripAdvisor user
444124864.reviewBody: It\'s not much, but there is nothing more to visit in the city. Beach behind is dirty and sometimes smelly.

442061072.name: Museum closed but nice view
442061072.author: a TripAdvisor user
442061072.reviewBody: I was just here last week but the museum was closed on the day I went, not sure if it is opened on other days.  I mostly just wanted to get photos of the pyramid and the beach.  You can climb up to the top.  I got a few decent photos of the area. It is a nice place to stop if you are already in the area but no need to travel far just to see this site.

376888720.name: Not great but woth the shot
376888720.author: a TripAdvisor user
376888720.reviewBody: If you are in Coatzacoalcos and have some free time, worthes to visit. It is small but have some good content

238289179.name: Poor.
238289179.author: a TripAdvisor user
238289179.reviewBody: They have nothing in it, Just a few pieces of craft things and thats all. Cost $30.00 the entrance, but in my opinion it should be free.\nWas not interesting for me.

145123342.name: nice little collection
145123342.author: a TripAdvisor user
145123342.reviewBody: its  a rather small archeolical collection , the museum should be more tourist oriented and offer video explanations in english and fench also needs to have belingual staff  and a sigh out side to advise visitors \n\n
